intro: Polycarpon involucratum, commonly known as the hairy bladder campion, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy leaves and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is known for its delicate appearance. Polycarpon involucratum is typically found in disturbed areas and along roadsides.
